security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and behavioral guidelines. No code execution, no network access, no filesystem writes. Uses only Read and Task tools for task parallelization guidance.

content.value_statement: Multiple independent tasks often run sequentially when they could execute simultaneously. This skill identifies parallelizable tasks and executes them concurrently, reducing total execution time significantly.
actual_capabilities: Detects which tasks can run independently without file or data dependencies
Launches multiple Task agents concurrently with background execution
Generates unified execution reports from parallel task results
Handles partial failures with success preservation and retry options
limitations: Cannot parallelize tasks with shared file dependencies
Cannot execute dependent tasks in parallel (e.g., API client before components using it)
Database migrations and other ordered operations must run sequentially

use_cases.title: Analyze multiple directories
use_cases.description: Review code by analyzing different project directories simultaneously (components, lib, app folders)

use_cases.title: Run quality checks in parallel
use_cases.description: Execute linting, type checking, and tests at the same time for faster CI/CD feedback

use_cases.title: Build independent components
use_cases.description: Create multiple independent UI components (header, footer, sidebar) simultaneously

prompt_templates.title: Analyze project structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this project structure and tell me about the framework, key directories, and overall architecture

prompt_templates.title: Run quality checks
prompt_templates.prompt: Check everything - run lint, type-check, and tests together

prompt_templates.title: Build multiple components
prompt_templates.prompt: Create the header, footer, and sidebar components for this project

prompt_templates.title: Complex multi-feature development
prompt_templates.scenario: Large feature implementation with multiple parts
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement all these features from Plans.md in parallel where possible

output_examples.input: Check the code quality and analyze the project structure

best_practices: Group truly independent tasks together for maximum parallelization benefit
Let the skill automatically detect dependencies rather than manually specifying
Use Plans.md to organize tasks with clear dependencies marked for sequential execution
anti_patterns: Attempting to parallelize tasks that modify the same files
Running database migrations in parallel with other operations
Forcing parallel execution on tasks with clear input/output dependencies

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The parallel execution capability depends on the Task tool availability.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of parallel tasks?
faq.answer: Task tool limits vary by plan. Start with 3-5 parallel tasks for optimal resource usage.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Automatically activates on trigger phrases. It reads Plans.md to identify parallelizable tasks and coordinates execution.

faq.question: Is my data safe with parallel execution?
faq.answer: Yes. No data leaves your environment. The skill only coordinates local Task tool execution.

faq.question: What happens if one parallel task fails?
faq.answer: Other tasks continue. Failed task details are reported. Successful task results are preserved for review.

faq.question: How is this different from sequential task execution?
faq.answer: Tasks run concurrently instead of one after another. Typical speedup is 50-70% for 3 parallel tasks.
